description: Number of pairs of numbers (a,b) each less than n where (a,b,n) is in geometric progression.
comments: Also, the number of integers k in {1,2,...,n-1} such that k*n is square. - John W. Layman, Sep 08 2011a(A005117(n)) = 0; a(A013929(n)) > 0; A008966(n) = A000007(a(n)); a(A133466(n)) = 1; a(A195085(n)) = 2. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 27 2012]
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(72)=5 since (2,12,72), (8,24,72), (18,36,72), (32,48,72), (50,60,72) are the possible three term geometric progressions.
prog: (Haskell)a057918 n = sum $ map ((0 ^) . (`mod` n) . (^ 2)) [1..n-1]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 27 2012
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Nov 22 2000
